website_summaries.verdict: Enhanced blower attachments on this blower can be used to calibrate the air flow.
pros: 3 functions on the blower include a blower, vacuum, and leaf shredder
Blows at speeds up to 225 mph
Mulched leaves and debris break down to less than half-inch size for compact disposal
Quick-release latch makes it easy to assemble and take apart with no tools
Power on this electric model is 12 amps at 120 volts
cons: Not powerful enough to suck up leaves as fast as expected
Vacuum bag is difficult to empty

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: Well, I purchased this product end of March, got delivered beginning of May and just wanted to use it and it didn't work. Since I was out of warranty I asked one of our electricians to check it out. He opened the unit and found out it was used, and it wasn't a new product. See attached photo to proof my point.
customer_reviews.author: KHB

customer_reviews.title: Ok with issues
customer_reviews.text: First let me say I like this blower and it is a compact model powerful to blow wet leafs. However the down side is it vibrates because of its light weight and therefore limits the length of time used. It also has a terrible connection to your electrical extension cord and the cord lock design does not hold the cord tightly so that it will disconnect constantly in use. I have to use tape to hold it in place. I purchased two units and my comments apply to both my units. Lastly it is very loud in operation. So would I purchase this unit again my answer is yes because overall it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Emc

customer_reviews.title: In short- low price, good quality, good performance.
customer_reviews.text: Worth it's weight in gold. This will save use hours of raking and hours of strain on your back. I am so happy with this little leaf blower. It's light weight and powerful. I bought the 160mph model and found that that was enough power for me- and anyone with a small to medium size yard. Now if you have a large piece pf property you will want to get one of the stronger more powerful leaf blowers. But, I'm sure this 160mph version will work for most home owners. And the price was so reasonable- at the time I bought it it was $35. In short- low price, good quality, good performance.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Eisenhuth

customer_reviews.title: Happy Gardener
customer_reviews.text: A great purchase for me. This leaf blower has all the features I was looking for: high/low speed, lightweight and compact. It’s very simplistic ... plug it into an extension cord, aim, and turn it on by sliding the switch to low or high. So easy to handle and maneuver around the yards. The low speed worked great at blowing the leaves from the rock garden while leaving everything else in its place. The high speed handled everything else. This blower is also quieter than the 3 that I have owned (different manufacturer).
customer_reviews.author: Lavinia Rose

customer_reviews.title: NEEDS RECALL!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS NOTHING AGAINST SELLER!!! This item needs to be recalled...caught my brothers house on fire in the middle of the night and I was using recently for only 5 minutes and it melted the attached extension cord to it. Thank goodness I unplugged cord from house as sometimes I leave plugged in while doing other chores. NEVER LEAVE UNATTENDED!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: I'm not impressed
customer_reviews.text: For nearly a decade I've used a Black&Decker Leafhog (BV4000) for almost solely blowing purposes (used the vac maybe once or twice) until it finally quit on me the other day. So i chose this Toro for a replacement. I must say I'm NOT impressed. This 225mph rated blower doesn't seem to pack the same punch as my old Leafhog (rated at 230mph), and the blower tube on this one is a good six inches shorter (which might be fine if I were 5'6" or shorter) so I have to bend low to get it close to the ground for those stubborn spots. I'm missing my old blower already.
customer_reviews.author: D. Forrest

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it but it has little power, returned & bought 12 amp
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it but it has little power compared to what I used to have. I had to be right in front or on top of the tiny branches & leaves for them to blow away & in south florida that's not going to work. It was double the work & time to clean my driveway. I ended up Buying a 12amp blower & thats perfect. Returned this
customer_reviews.author: sandra r

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this exactly 2 years ago. Used it maybe 6-8 times. Kept in garage. Started and immediately broke this morning. It was the most unreliable electric tool I have ever purchased. Such disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: kdfuser

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: My blower arrived a day earlier which I was thrilled about. It came just in time to tackle the fall leaves. I used it for 45 minutes and the switch went bad. It is a two speed and now has only one speed which is low. I had to borrow my neighbors. Returning this one and will get one locally just in case it happens again. My old Torro lasted 17 years and was a work horse. This is nothing like it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth G.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I have used this blower ONE TIME and the switch failed. It is supposed to be a two speed blower it is not. I have one speed and it that speed is intermittent - on and off on and off on and off. Save yourself some aggravation buy something else. You might as well get on your hands and knees and huff an puff your leaves away. I took delivery of this POS June 16, 2019. I used it once to blow leaves off my deck. Today I tried to use it to blow leaves off my driveway. The switch only has one position (supposed to be 2) and it cuts on and off by itself.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Little

customer_reviews.title: Best leaf blower for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful leaf blower! If you want to really move some leaves, this is the blower! I have had a couple of good leaf blowers in the past, but this Toro model is incredible. Even the low setting is more than needed for most jobs. The position of the handle keeps the blower in balance as you use it. Also, the weight is light enough that it doesn't wear your arm out. I highly recommend this blower. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it was re-packed but works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leaf blower for primarily to dry our cars after washing and to blow out the garage and porches. When I opened the box I noticed the packing was torn apart and fingerprints all over the blower...but I snapped it together, plugged it in and so far it is working nicely. I will probably follow this review up in a couple of weeks.. but so far so good ! But taking a star off for the repacking.
customer_reviews.author: Marty P

customer_reviews.title: I love that it sucks up the leaves and chops them ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest! I love that it sucks up the leaves and chops them up, like a lawnmower, and shoots them into a bag. It makes the pain of bagging raked up leaves a thing of the past! The strength of the suck is very good. You just have to go slower. The blower is very strong! Easy to use and change out the attachments. Very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Dent

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this one which includes a vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I had a Toro blower that lasted about 20 years so when the plastic blower nozzle clip stopped holding the plastic blower nozzle, I knew I wanted another Toro... So glad I bought this one which includes a vacuum. Works Great! Was so much easier vacuuming leaves out of my flower beds than blowing then all into a large pile and picking them up by hand and dumping into the garden recycle container. The 2 motor settings is also really helpful than just 1 full blast blower-Great product!
customer_reviews.author: seeks4life

customer_reviews.title: VIBRATION
customer_reviews.text: Its a 2 speed unit. At low speed, its fine but when you switch to high speed the noise and vibration is awful. It feels like its going to come apart in your hands and I'm sure over a period of time, this vibration will tear up the unit. I knew this was possible when I purchased the unit but I was not expecting it to be this bad. Since it is a TORO I was hoping it would be better than Black and Decker units but no the case.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Knight

customer_reviews.title: Vibration
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Toro I had for 10 years that died abruptly due to the motor almost catching fire. This unit is not as easy to hold nor does it seem to really blow as well though it is rated at the same level as my old unit. It also vibrates like crazy. Too bad the quality has gone down as I relied on the Toro brand to be great quality as it had been in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: IT'S GOING BACK
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a product not made in China, so I gave this a try after my 7.5 amp B&D died (lasted over 10 years, but it's made in China, so not to going to patronize that country anymore). There is a terrible vibration in the unit when you turn it on, and my hand goes numb. It's also not as powerful as my old one, so back it goes. Going to give Makita a look see.
customer_reviews.author: Support Wounded Warriors

customer_reviews.title: Two speeds are a big plus.
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying the two speeds. The low speed gives more control around my potted plants in the patio. The high speed is perfectly adequate for everything else. There are two issues that I did not have with my B&D brand. First, the switch is very sensitive and you can move it from low to high unintentionally. Secondly, the hook for the cord is not long enough so the cord slips out and unplugs. I have a new cord and maybe the problem will rectify itself as the cord becomes more flexible. Even with these two issues, I would not trade it for a one speed.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in East Texas

customer_reviews.title: Works for small yards clean up with light work.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job in my small yard with easy cleanup. Good for small jobs. The reviews talking about leaf clean up are ridiculous. It’s good for leaves on a small scale. Don’t assume you can use it for large yards with a lot of trees. If you have a large yard with a lot of leaves use your head and invest in a good blower made for that job.
customer_reviews.author: EAY

customer_reviews.title: Great Leaf Blower
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a little over a week and I don’t know why I waited so long to buy a leaf blower. I use it to clear my driveway and patio and so far it works for all sorts of debris (leaves, rock, dirt, water...) The variable speed is a great feature. Most things can be cleared on the low speed but water benefits from the higher speed. The build quality does seem to be on the cheaper side so being more careful with this is probably going to make sure it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: this is great. Maybe if there was a clip of some ...
customer_reviews.text: Other than the extension cord plug doesn't stay in the plug on the end of the leaf blower without it having to be wrapped around the handle or taped in, this is great. Maybe if there was a clip of some kind that went over the end of the power cord and clipped it down to the leaf blower. Silly thing kept coming unplugged. Hahaha! Perfect power for just doing small yards and areas, lightweight so I am able to hold it and maneuver it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbi McNeil

customer_reviews.title: My first snowblower-excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: Never used a snowblower before, so I can't really compare it to anything but here is this: open the box, plug it in, turn it on and go to work. Simple as that. I found in powerful enough to blow even some wet leaves into piles in my yard. Took some getting used to how close to get to the leaves, and what angle I needed, but other than being very loud, I have no complaints. Pretty lightweight as well. My dogs enjoyed chasing the leaves that blew all over when I was getting used to using it, too. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: pboy

customer_reviews.title: Expecting Failure at Any Moment
customer_reviews.text: So far this Toro blows and vacs like a champ. The problem is that the motor makes an awful grinding noise. I think it's only a matter of time before this motor blows up. I previously had a Toro leaf blower identical to this one. It also had a motor that made a terrible grinding noise and eventually the motor burned up and quit working. When I have to replace this one I won't buy online. I'll buy from a brick and mortar store so that I can test the leaf blower before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: speycast4steelhead

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this one to replace one exacly like it
customer_reviews.text: The thing that I like most about this unit, besides the price, is that it has two speeds. It is powerful enough to clean my deck and sidewalks, but when on the lower speed, I can blow items from within my rocks and gravel. I had one just like this prior and it worked well but eventually, the motor started smelling like it was burning. It is lightweight enough for any elderly person to handle and yet powerful enough to take on the larger jobs. I would recommend this blower for home use.
customer_reviews.author: The Polarbare

customer_reviews.title: MAY BE TORO'S WORST DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS NOT AS ADVERTISED........THE VAC IS WORTHLESS, THE BAG ASSEMBLEY IS DIFFICULT TO ADJUST AND WHO WOULD DESIGN A POWER PLUG IN THE FRONT OF THE MACHINE. MOST IF NOT ALL ENGINEERS AND DESIGN PERSONNEL WOULD KNOW THAT A FRONT PLUG IN IS A PROBLEM.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this Toro blower!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, I’m in love💕 I have a birdfeeder hanging above my patio and my birds make one heck of a mess and I was sweeping several times every day to try and keep it from tracking into my home. I bought the blower and have never been so happy with a product purchased before. It has awesome power, it’s easy to assemble, super easy to handle and it’s lightweight. Just be sure to order a outdoor power cord with it if you don’t have one.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great little electric blower, fantastic price-point
customer_reviews.text: Got this little blower for a great price (around $36) and it does exactly what I need it to do. We have a good sized lawn, around .35 acres, and have sidewalks on 2 sides of the property. So a fair amount to use the blower on. This little guy works like a champ! Great airspeed for a small electric blower that is SUPER light. Weighs just under 5 lbs and produces 155 CFM mass flow. Really impressive for a unit of this size and price-point. Very happy with this purchase and hope it holds up for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Poole

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for dry leaf blowing and the price is very low.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Toro Power Vac but it finally quit on me after many years of service. I like that one too and I found out how to easily fix. But in the mean time I wanted a good leaf, grass, dirt debris blower. The new model is very light but gets the job done when it comes to dry blowing. I really never used the leaf vacuum on my older much heavier Toro Power Vac. So I am very pleased it does everything I need I my yard. But the really great thing is how light it is. So it met and exceeded all my expectations. I just got done using on my yard this evening.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.N.

customer_reviews.title: Weak....Don't be fooled by MPH
customer_reviews.text: Weak flow from oval nozzle... no volume, which is what you need to move debris, not MPH
customer_reviews.author: BobHarley291

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a LONG time!
customer_reviews.text: We first bought this blower in 2008 and have now ordered a new one in 2020. The old one worked very well and lasted 12 years. For a $40 product that's about as good as you could ask. The new one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: This blower is weak. We had a previous model of it that was a lot stronger. This barely blows the dirt from our sidewalk when you are practically on top of it. Very disappointment. The only reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is because I like that it comes with the attachments to make it a blower or suction appliance.
customer_reviews.author: ELLIE F

customer_reviews.title: It just died and I'm ordering another
customer_reviews.text: After four years of faithful use on the low setting clearing my back patio, this Toro finally died. The power started to dip and rise during use and then the smoke started coming from the plug (see photo). I just put another one in my basket and feel like four years of weekly, sometimes daily use, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Evans

customer_reviews.title: It's ok...
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting to blow small amounts of grass clippings or dust, this is the machine for you. If it's anything more than a small clump, not going to happen. I got this model because my dad bought the same model about 5 years ago and it blows like a hurricane. This one, not so much. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: dprejean

customer_reviews.title: I like it and it made a nice change from ripping ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it and it made a nice change from ripping my arm out of its socket trying to start a gas powered Ryobi model. Simply put, plug in and go. One little niggle, the electric hook up is just about 1 foot down the cable from the blower and as you walk around with it, the electric lead that plugs into it, gets pulled out very, very, easily. I started using it by holding the lead as I walk around, but I shouldn't have to. Toro might want to consider fitting a small clip to keep the electric lead firmly in place. Nothing dangerous, just a little niggle.
customer_reviews.author: David Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower/mulcher is awesome! I have used it several times since I purchased this. It works great and being it only cost around $50 I feel like I got a great deal. The blower works really well, and the mulching does good as well. One thing I find awkward about it is is how you have to hold it when it is in the mulching setting. You kind of have to hold it straight out in front of you and being I am not very tall, it is a little cumbersome, but gives you a good ab workout...(: I am glad I purchased it and hope to have it a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest

customer_reviews.title: Great blower.  This is one you will fight over with your spouse.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little dynamo so much. It is so light weight and easy to use one handed even for those of us with arthritis. However it doesn't work like a toy.... it is the real deal. Cleans the porch and walkway, also the inside of the cars. You might want to order two because now I can't get mine away from my husband's shop!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor vac for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good tool for my yard. Constantly clogs. Last use smelled burning from unit. Now it wont start up. Taking back to Toro dealer for repair/replacement. Saw all the great reviews and was excited to use. After a few uses, easier to rake leafs into a pile and bag than use this thing. Takes forever to mulch and longer to clear clogs every few minutes. Bag design stinks! Needs side zipper to dump into required paper bags without spilling. My yard has large leafs so this may be the problem. Mower better option for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lambo 1970

customer_reviews.title: it works great. It's the vac that I love though
customer_reviews.text: The leaf blower is as expect, it works great. It's the vac that I love though. It made cleaning my gutters a breeze. But where I really felt awesome was cleaning the pine needles and small pine cones out of river rock. Kind of feels like you're an alien spaceship abducting everything in sight. It also worked wonders for getting the grass clippings and other trash that finds their way into your edging, if your edging is over an inch like mine is
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: I love this blower
customer_reviews.text: I love this blower. I would give it five stars, but to be honest it's a little frustrating dragging a cord all around and having to plug and unplug as I move around my property. It works great for my sidewalks, patio, etc. However I have a very large yard and thus, to use it I would require an exceptionally long extension cord. I'll ultimately have to get a gas blower. However this isn't a problem with the blower. It works well, has ample thrust and is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a fantastic blower
customer_reviews.text: o my goodness what a fantastic blower / vacuum i could not wait to use my new leaf blower it is all i have been talking about since i brought it light weight and fast i have a large yard and this blower did the job in under 1 hour it 's the best i ever had for a yard tool it cut my work in half what a great buy
customer_reviews.author: soadpop

customer_reviews.title: Plastic rotar? Really, Toro.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two Toro leaf blower/mulchers. The other two were great and still work as far as I know. They stayed with the properties when they sold. I ordered this model for my new home, and I haven't used it yet, but I'm very disappointed to see the rotar that shreds the leaves is made out of PLASTIC. On the previous two models, this piece was metal. I can just imagine what will happen the first time I pick up a twig. The plastic will snap and I'll be out of commission! But I'm going to give it a go. The plus side is that I have a tiny garden (18'X22') so it might be fine with such minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: regencyreb

customer_reviews.title: good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a smaller blower for our smaller backyard and for my age, 60. The description said two speeds, which it has, but I guess I was hoping for a slower, less harsh speed so as to be able to blow the debris into a pile to be picked up. Still, it works.
customer_reviews.author: 3 Cat Mama

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I lo love it. It is very powerful, have a small back yard with 7 leafy trees that shed more than just leaves during the year. This blower is a work horse and keeps my yard very tidy. It will also blow light enough in the rock paths the keep them free of leaves. I love it. I have two of them one for front and one for backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Bellapopish

customer_reviews.title: NOGO on this Item
customer_reviews.text: Had to return, defective: would speedup/slow down by itself...Also: there are lighter units on the market, high decibel sound, no provisions to keep cord connected to unit...
customer_reviews.author: Dustman

customer_reviews.title: JUST BOUGHT ONE FOR MY 90 YEAR OLD MOTHER!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, she still works in her garden. I have had mine for 5 years, it is very lightweight, 4 lbs, and I am glad cause I am 72. Mom was complaining about a neighbor who mows and leaves her driveway in a mess, and I know this Toro will take care of her needs, and she will have no problem using it either. If you want a lightweight blower you need to try this one, the price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews and decided to give this a try. My husband was skeptical that it would have enough power. We were pleasantly surprised. We are both older and it is so light weight it made the work almost fun. Would not be great for a large yard but perfect for ours and it was great not having to put gas and oil in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Price...Price...Price
customer_reviews.text: I have back problems and have been waiting to purchase a blower/vac but all were too high in price, then I found this and decided to buy one. Glad I did saves so much time and frustration being able to get work done with out having to take 3-4 days recuperating. Much needed and am happy I went with Amazon and Toro
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Plastics Internals Will Break!
customer_reviews.text: This product has a PLASTIC fan and parts inside. We paid $60.51 on 9 Sep 17 and plastic parts broke 28 Sep 19. Guess how long the warranty lasts? That’s right, 2 years. Haha, thats great! Will look for a blower with METAL parts. Oh, the manufacturer web site had TONS of comments just like mine, so, THEY KNOW the products limitations! Scary.
customer_reviews.author: RAH!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I ran it on high power for 3 hours straight in the rain and never had a problem with it. Low speed keeps my mulch still then high speed cleaned my entire front and back yard. Might buy a few more for xmas gifts (Picture is from a few days later, it definitely got every leaf)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Childers

customer_reviews.title: Toro Super Blower/Vacuum 'For Teh Win'
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use, this blower/vacuum has two speeds and both can do the job quickly. Use it on the lawn, in the garage or anywhere you do not want to rake or sweep. It might be overkill for dust mopping but it works super great on an outside deck.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and fairly powerful
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a leaf blower that was more lightweight and would still do the job....this one works fine. Its not the strongest one you can find...but certainly for the price...it has the features that were most important to us. Delivered quickly and good shape. I would purchase again.....
customer_reviews.author: Donald Staats

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Has great power and is lightweight. Minus one star for the fact, it shocked the crap out of me in very light rain. Maybe a more waterproof plug for something that gets used outside while doing yard work? Great for the price just invest in a weatherproof plug cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Pear

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a much older Toro blower/vac. I was expecting that it'd be little lighter than the old model and easier to maneuver. Instead it's every bit as heavy and awkward as my old blower/vac. Had I known this I would have held on to my old Toro model. That said, I especially like the vacuum feature and how it mulches leaves to about 1/10th volume.
customer_reviews.author: Allen EH

customer_reviews.title: Great blower for the price, not so great vacuum and mulcher
customer_reviews.text: I got the 225mph blower vac for $55 when the price dipped. The blower works quite well and you can adjust the strength by being more sensitive with the on/off switch. The vacuum was pretty inefficient as I had blown the leaves into a big pile and the vacuum was just not strong enough. I tried vacuuming for about 20 min and only got the attached bag half full and my pile just slightly dented. There's just not enough suction and it does not mulch well. However, for the price point, the blower is great.
customer_reviews.author: KingV

customer_reviews.title: Bad motor!! Do not buy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower on May 2017 and probably I used this blower like twice a month and now this thing doesn't work. Last weekend it was doing a weird sound the motor and today the motor didn't work. And the warranty of this thing is for a year. They actually calculate the life time of this machine.
customer_reviews.author: alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase - serious decline in power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same model 2 years ago and very satisfied with that product. That one was very powerful. The motor finally died this week. I ordered another and it came today. This latest purchase has about 75 % of the power the exact same model I bought before. Cannot recommend this to anyone for this reason. The next better model is 89.00.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: So fun to dry my car
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one of these much sooner. I bought this specifically for car care. My car is ceramic coated and the water beads were still standing in place hours after coming in from the rain. The leaf blower made easy work of ridding the water droplets and the car was 98% dry within two minutes without having to use a single towel. I love this thing! It has two speed settings and I would definitely recommend ear protection. I can't wait to use this left blower again the next time I wash my car, it's so quick and fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Nhan Hoang

customer_reviews.title: didnt last long and poor warranty policy
customer_reviews.text: stopped working right after Amazon return period expired. Toro wanted me to pay for shipping to get it repaired or replaced. Cost of shipping s bulky product like this was almost the cost of the product. Will never buy another Toro product again. Poor customer service and warranty policy.
customer_reviews.author: APSC

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars until a week ago when it stopped working after 7 months of use. It has a 2 year warranty but so far I have not found a way to even find the process for a warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Truly disappointed with the lack of force
customer_reviews.text: Bought to blow pine needles off our mountain cabin wood deck. Truly disappointed with the lack of force. Would have returned but waited too long.
customer_reviews.author: Bentfam

customer_reviews.title: Extremely heavy. Has plastic fence which will wear out when you’re sucking up leaves much quicker
customer_reviews.text: Extremely heavy. Has plastic fence which will wear out when you’re sucking up leaves much quicker. Not real excited about this if you need a blower that blows hard OK but it’s heavy get ready. I bought another blower on Amazon for 16 bucks absolutely love it got a buy about three more for my RV and shop.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Limited applications for this product
customer_reviews.text: Having owned and used the next model up of Toro leaf blower for at least 10 years, I was encouraged by their offering a slightly less powerful and lighter weight model. Unfortunately, this is a significantly less effective product. It is too underpowered to be used for any leaf blowing task except some kind of daily, deck/patio maintenance chore. Large quantities of leaves and/or wet leaves are a real challenge to move with this product. Just be aware of this when hyou are considering this light weight blower.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Carter

customer_reviews.title: More Power!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this on Sunday - 4 days ago - and have used it several times. It is lighter than my previous blower - which I dropped and broke. The Toro has 2 speeds which I like. However, the button that you push could be a little less sensitive from low to high speed otherwise I have to move it forward or backward a couple of times to get it at the correct speed. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I do not suck the leaves
customer_reviews.text: I waited to post a review after using it for one fall season. I do not suck the leaves,so I cannot comment on that functionality. I blow all leaves to a wild area in my backyard. PROs: - 2 speeds - Easy to maneuver - Works on wet leaves -- including large oak leaves that like to get stuck in the ground - Works on acorns and gumball seeds - I prefer plug-style vs battery or gas because the only thing needed is an extension cord and it will work. No maintenance. Negatives: - Extension cord storage - however I wrap it around the handle, and that works okay for a 50' cord.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful blower
customer_reviews.text: Mainly use it to blow leaves and sticks off my synthetic grass. Super powerful works great. I did try sucking up leaves and it worked great. Unfortunately I have a liquid amber tree that drops these round hard balls, the machine had a tough time processing them.
customer_reviews.author: Cap Retired

customer_reviews.title: It’ll do.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older more powerful version of this and was trying to replace it when it finally died. This one is much smaller and looks like I’m carrying some kids toy around the yard. I miss the last unit that blew so hard it was hard to hang on to but it sure did the job fast!
customer_reviews.author: kbron97

customer_reviews.title: Kind of heavy but as a vacuum/shredder works fine. I ended up using it only as a ...
customer_reviews.text: It works O.K. for shredding leaves but it is very cumbersome to put together and to change from leaf blower to vacuum and shred. Kind of heavy but as a vacuum/shredder works fine. I ended up using it only as a vacuum/shredder since it was too much work to change from one to the other, plus the blower may be good for big areas but not practical for smaller areas like a driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A 70+ yr old woman can handle it with ease!
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight and plugs into any outlet with three prongs. I love the power it has and how it cleans leaves of my patio and sidewalk...Oh, and my flowerbeds that get clogged with leaves in the fall? Just hit them with this baby and the leaves depart and my flowers again are visible! Overall, it is rugged, lightweight and not noisy like other leaf blowers! I wish I had bought one of these years ago! Can't tell you what a timesaver it is and who lightweight it is!
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I bought this with the specific intent to pair it with the gutter cleaning attachment. Both products work great and save me a ton of time cleaning my gutters. Be prepared to get dirty though as the powerful blower will spray leaves, water, and gutter debris everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: burnt out in 6 months definitely don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Initially this worked very well and one day it just stopped and i smelled something burning and it was the unit. A watse of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ing

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a larger/older Toro blower/vac that was suffering from the ravages of age. had never used the vac functionality on the prior machine (life is to short to mulch as you stroll) so that was not a criteria. 2 Speed operation is critical if you ever hope to 'pile' leaves/debris vs. blowing them back and forth. The 51585 has worked out very well for my requirements and my budget. I prefer the 'pig tail' power connection to plugging directly into the device (I think it prevents a lot of loose plug disconnects when there is strain on the cord). I'd have no problem in recommending this to anyone who only wanted a blower (versus an outdoor vacuum).
customer_reviews.author: Rock of Ages

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: Looked around a lot and read a lot of reviews before buy this Toro. Very strong blower, rounded up a huge pile of leave in no time. The vaccum option is best used for "light" clean up. I tried a seriously large pile after the maple dropped about 75% of it's leaves the other weekend. It became clear I'd have to emply that little bag 100+ times. Ended up bagging by hand. But vac the stragglers since then and in flower beds. Super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Calligan

customer_reviews.title: Small but has lots of power!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to! For being so small has a lot of power! Only thing is the annoying plug you drag around but for around yard it’s Perfect! My husband details his cars and will also use this to dry his cars so no rubbing towels and making swirls in paint and works great for that too!
customer_reviews.author: Missy!

customer_reviews.title: Light but Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This blower came in today and I've used it to do some clean up around the garage. I have a yard crew but needed a small blower for odd jobs around the garage and patio. This is a perfect fit for my needs and I'm very happy with it. It is light and the two speed feature is helpful as I blow out nooks and crannies in the garage. I have no need for the vacuum feature which is available on some of the larger blowers so this one was a great option. I'm pleased!
customer_reviews.author: David Bower

customer_reviews.title: Cut your yard work down efficiently
customer_reviews.text: I regret not buying this earlier. I had a piddly little thing before that didn't have the vacuum and that destroyed my back as I bent over to optimize its ability to blow my detritus. No longer. With this, a previously half hour job is reduced to five minutes or less! Further, I'm not just blowing stuff around, I'm cleaning it up and dumping it post mulching, which conserves yard waste space. There's nothing I don't like about this blower.
customer_reviews.author: gfkokai

customer_reviews.title: Use 14 gauge or better not 16.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but please note Amazon is touting 16 gauge 100 foot cords; the manufacturer says minimum 14 gauge (and 12 gauge for the more power-sucking models. I had a 12 gauge I bought after Sandy, which is too wide to fit in their "cord lock" gizmo, but of course you can simply knot it around the back of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Shallcross

customer_reviews.title: chops up leaves very well
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a leaf vacuum, not as a blower. It does well as a vacuum and grinds the leaves very fine. It may be heavy for some people as the bag gets full, and takes some trial and error to get a comfortable way to hold the vac .But I love it. The ground up leaves will be a great addition to my compost pile next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Bookend

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful...
customer_reviews.text: This blower is very compact and powerful...just what I needed to quickly clean up my porches and driveway. It does require an extension cord, but since I already had a 50ft cord lying around, that was no problem....only thing I would change, or really, add, is maybe a telescoping nozzle...the one it comes with is on the shorter side, which is fine since it keeps the tool compact and easy to use, but sometimes I'd like to either put nozzle directly on floor, or blow off ceiling, and a longer nozzle option would better facilitate that....only used it twice so far, so can't speak for durability, but I give it 5 stars for function
customer_reviews.author: R. Dancel

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I think it's pretty lightweight (6 lbs) though I did see a few closer to 4 lbs. Bought it for my senior mom who seems to be able to handle it just fine. She uses it to blow out the leaves from the garage and off the porch.
customer_reviews.author: S. SmithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Poor redesign of a great product.
customer_reviews.text: First the good + the internal workings of this seem to be like their older model - good power. Now the bad - The redesigned nozzle has a small piece at the end to focus the air. Previously this was part of the overall assembly. The new piece is constantly coming out of place. - The old knob style on/off switch was easy to use even with work gloves. The new slide switch is much harder to use and just looks/feels cheap. - The old cord lock mechanism was easy to lock in the cord and take it out -- the new design is much harder to use.
customer_reviews.author: vlmillard

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best tools I've EVER bought !
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best tools I've EVER bought ! Primarily, I use it to blow all the grass & leaves off my ZTR when I finish mowing, even blow it UNDER the mower BEFORE hooking it up to the hose connection and flushing it with water. This handly light weight little blower has mighty power, both on low & on high, and will clean off your deck, sidewalk, garage floor, whatever you need it for. Blow the leaves & dirft out of your camper or car or truck....wherever you need cleaning power. You won't regret owning one of these little Toro's !
customer_reviews.author: CatLuvvur

customer_reviews.title: Kick butt little bugger
customer_reviews.text: Love this little bugger! I'm a bowl turner and needed something to blow out sawdust and it's the best!! I have to use the low setting or it would blow some of my tools away. Lightweight, easy to handle, clean up is so quick and easy now that it's a pleasure!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Unit
customer_reviews.text: This is the second leaf blower for the house. The first is a large blower, much larger, much heavier, and you have to put it together to use it. It's a very good blower but as I said it heavy and not something the Lady of house can handle. That's why I got the Toro leaf blower and I'm glad I did because this unit is sweet. Nothing for her to put together and yet light enough she doesn't have any problems using it. Even on the low setting, it can clear the patio and walkway with ease. Really glad I got it for her!
customer_reviews.author: David A. McElhannon

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: It did not last long afterlight use. Something came apart inside of it and now it sounds like a jet engine taking off. Went to take it apart and fix it but found out shortly there after the fan shredded some critical components.
customer_reviews.author: Family Fun

customer_reviews.title: Great After a Year of Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this used here over a year ago. I needed to blow things around - mainly grass. I have had zero problems after a year of use and would recommend it to anyone looking to blow grass off of their driveways. I know lots of people use blowers for many other things and need more powerful engines, but this one was perfect for me. On average, during nine months out of the year, I'll use this about once a week for about ten minutes per session. Without doubt, the Toro 51585 Power Sweep has been a great purchase for me and I hope to get much more use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ansen Plopbundle

customer_reviews.title: Sucks as a vac
customer_reviews.text: Blower is fine but don’t call this a vac. Instructions for use to vac leaves: dry each individual leaf with a towel or rag, remove the stem and lay it flat on high grass away from any other leaves or debris. Suck that leaf up and repeat for each leaf. Seriously this thing clogged more than it worked. MUCH FASTER TO RAKE!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Millikan

customer_reviews.title: P3-phenomenal price and power!!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think a blower at this price would be worth the effort of ordering. I was wrong. I bought it for my 96 year old mom. Yep, that’s right. It is so powerful yet so light I may replace my battery blower at home!
customer_reviews.author: LGB

customer_reviews.title: Great Leaf blower, low price!
customer_reviews.text: Great price, perfect 4lb light weight. Easy packaging and barely no assembly required. Got the job done and big pile of leaves out of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: good basic blower
customer_reviews.text: good basic blower with no bells and wistles i would not use. i don't need a vacuum. i couldn't use it anyway. my yard is gravel. even so i had to use the low speed because it will blow the graval away on high speed. its half the weight and size of my old blower and has more blowing power. it's quieter too. one problem is the cord relief holder. it is flimsy plastic and it does not holde the power cord in place for long. the extention cord keeps poping out of it. i have to wrap the cord around the handle instead of the cord relief holder supplied. good job toro.
customer_reviews.author: E sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Terrible leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: Terrible leaf blower, when I tried to suck up leaves it blew tons of dirt in my face and was not effective in sucking up leaves at all, good blower though for blowing leaves in a pile but I just ended up raking the leaves into bins because vacuum function was ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Ajoneil

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Toro it's replacing
customer_reviews.text: This is still, I believe, the best blower for the money, as long as your good with extension cord management. I really think the older Toro blower I had (for many years - the on off switch broke) was better (stronger). I never use the vacuum function.
customer_reviews.author: J Walter

customer_reviews.title: After all, this is the one
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many all in one blower/vacuum this one is the best. Don't get me wrong, all of them are somewhat heavy but this feel the lightest out of all. It's very powerful plus not that big and it's very convenient
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynGuy

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this blower a year and a half ago. It is now done. The plug in started melting, smoking and then caught on fire. I'm very lucky nothing happened to me. It's very scary. However. $60, 1 year and a half, worked well. But th vacuum did not.
customer_reviews.author: Jamielynn

customer_reviews.title: Product started giving off burning smell after 6 months, so I stopped using it.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked just fine since I purchased it in Sept 2014. I used it about 3-4 times a month, to blow patio , driveway, walkways. Then in March of 2015 or so, it started to smell like it was burning when I would use it so I would turn it off, thinking it was overeating and I needed to let it rest, which had never happened before. Then the burning smell became more common, so out of fear I stopped using it. It should last longer than 6 months!!!
customer_reviews.author: Judith Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Very Good With A Reason For Low Price
customer_reviews.text: This is very light and was a gift for a senior. It meets the need very well. It is light and good for light work. If you have heavy duty needs, the more costly Toros will suit you better. But, for the purpose of this gift, an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. I wore the first one out. I've used this all year round for blowing leaves off decorative rocks too just cleaning leaves off the yard. Never had any problem with the leaf blower. It lasted about 2 years with every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Jamus

customer_reviews.title: Blown away with this product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a leaf blower and didn’t know what I was looking for. So I did my research and found this super strong and mighty light blower. It also wasn’t extremely loud either. I’m beyond impressed. Super fast shipping. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Guy E. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PERFORMANCE FOR THE COST
customer_reviews.text: This blower replaces a Craftsman which was rated at 200 mph. It is not a powerful but does a good job. Wish it had a longer nozzle to keep debris further away in case the wind changes direction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product as expected.
customer_reviews.text: My previous Toro leaf blower wore out after using for about 10-years. I liked it so well that I decided to replace it with a newToro. It might be my imagination, but this new Toro doesn't seem quite as powerful as my old one? However, this new Toro does the job as expected and am quite happy with it. In my opinion, I wouldn't consider any other brand of leaf blower.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra E. Collin

customer_reviews.title: Like this Blower
customer_reviews.text: I got this blower because of its ratings since I had never owned a Toro. It is very quiet but seems to have a little less blowing power than my old Black & Decker that it replaced. Even with that, I would buy it again since I don't require powerful blowing. If someone needs that I would recommend a blower with more velocity & air movement, but for my purposes - clean- up after mowing & light leaf blowing- this one is more than adequate. Pros:Light weight & very quiet.T he cord retainer is great as I have to tie-off my cord on other models. Cons: Maybe a bit light on air movement, but still enough for most purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Horn

product_meta.title: Toro 51618 Super Blower/Vacuum, 225 mph Vac
product_meta.description: Size:225 mph Blower/VacToro is the #1 rated electric blower Brand. The Super blower vac features a two-speed motor, & even easier Conversion between blowing & vacuuming. The powerful 230-mph maximum air stream clears sticks, debris & even large, heavy leaves. It converts quickly to an aggressive vacuum without any tools & reduces leavesup to 10 bags to 1 the two-speed motor gives you more control in both blower & vacuum modes. You can't buy a more powerful hand-held blower - gas or electric. 12 amp motor 3 machines in one; powerful blower, high speed vacuum & leaf shredder blower inserts for multiple applications IMPROVED air power, up to 230 mph (370. 1 kpm) maximum air speed reduces 10 bags of leaves into 1 quick release latch for easy no tools Conversion blower inserts for multiple applications. Additional info: air speed: max. 230 mph (370. 1 kpm) leaf shredding reduction: 10: 01 UL listed: Standard vacuum capability: standard.
feature_bullets: Up to 81% of mulched debris reduced to less than 1/2-inch
Debris reduction varies with material type and its condition
3 machines in one; powerful blower, high speed vacuum and leaf shredder
Quick-release latch for easy, no tools conversion. Leaf shredding reduction - 10: 01

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars819 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
